reviewText:
Ok once again a jigsaw puzzle game from  the Decaying Logic team.

Positive changes from the others

No stupid erase your progress Koi!
You are not being seiged by zombies.
Game now SAVES your progress. You place a piece right, it's there waiting in place the next time you play that puzzle.

Negative changes

You can't kill/punch/mute that stupid fairy!

Yes that's correct each version of this series has an anoying factor. This time it's a constantly chattering floating scientist fairy that micro fairy dusts you in small slow slow increments power ups. Hate her so much.

Cool changes

Now you're going to have to rotate pieces. Adds wonderful chalenge to each puzzle.


Basically  though there's a new game anoyance factor to go with the puzzle theme change. But at least now you don't have to restart a puzzle from the begining. It'll save your spot. BIG plus!

Worth buying if you enjoy a good jigsaw puzzle.

7/10

reviewText:
I was tempted to not recommend this based on the very irritating fairy swimming around your puzzle and interjecting obnoxious comments every thirty seconds or so.  Then I discovered that the fairy can be removed with the delete key and life was suddenly much better.  This does, unfortunately, also disable her hint functions, but since I personally wasn't interested in using hints (what's the point in that, it's a puzzle!), getting rid of the fairy was well worth the lack of hints.

The game itself is a straightforward jigsaw puzzle set, with various piece counts and pictures.  The pieces do require rotation which adds some challenge that was absent from previous games in this series (I enjoy the other installments but they went much faster).

So in the end, since I was able to disable the fairy from hell, I will recommend this for anyone who likes a good jigsaw.  However, if you do want to use the hint function attached to the fairy, bear in mind that you'll either have to listen to her prattle or you'll have to shut off the sound for the whole game (as there is no separate volume control for voice vs music/sound effects).

reviewText:
My first Pixel Puzzles game was Pixel Puzzles: Japan which I really played the heck out of. Perfect for someone who likes jigsaws but doesn't want half finished puzzles lying around the house. But Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime....ugh! I really regret buying this game.

Firstly, unless I'm missing something, they have still not installed a save function. So unless you are certain you have enough time to finish a puzzle of several hundred pieces, don't start. Mostly though, I haven't met a helper" I've hated more since the Microsoft Office paperclip. With constant jibberish like "I know where that piece goes but I'm not gonna tell ya!" the only answer is to turn all the sound off since there is no option to get rid of her or turn her annoying voice off. Not that losing the sound really matters as the soundtrack seems to want to turn doing a jigsaw into some sort of aciton platformer with it's stress inducing rushed melody.

Anyhow
date: if you want a jigsaw puzzle game
recommended: for for the very zen Pixel Puzzles: Japan. Much MUCH less stressful. Because hey
hoursPlayed: if I wanted a game to stress me out
voteText: I'd play Dota2!"

reviewText:
Im not a huge anime fan, but I am into puzzle games and I generally enjoy them when I get some time to sit down to play them.

When I got this one I was expecting it to be like the other Pixel Puzzle game that I had owned, but it had some different elements that I did like and some that I was not a fan of.

I did enjoy how the snap to worked in this one, a lot more fluid and easier to get where the pieces go if your not completely sure which is big. The music was not terrible and there are plenty of puzzles to complete.

My one big gripe with the game is the puzzle slices, generally the way a puzzle is cut up makes a huge difference and the way they are cut in this game is incredibly frustrating. The pieces are stringy and hard to tell where exactly they go, being that the colors are so bright and there isnt a huge amount of contrast on some of the puzzles so its hard to tell where exactly some of the pieces fit. When they are floating in the water though its hard to pick them.

If you enjoy anime and puzzle games though id suggest giving it a shot.
voteText: 14 of 16 people (88%) found this review helpful 1 person found this review funny

reviewText:
Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime belongs to a series of games focusing on jigsaw mechanics on a thematic. The previous ones are about Zombies, Japan or Birds. Here, you'll get images in an anime style - remember, anime is the term often used to describe cartoons from Japan.

The goal is the same: unlock more complicated puzzles (more numbers, more shapes, etc..) and rebuild the picture. You can use bonus if you collected enough fairy dusts, like the right place of the piece, or the complete image shown for a few seconds. While the pieces are floating in a sort of water, they're not necessarily already in the right direction. I mean by that that you'll need to rotate them to find the exact fitting.

I enjoyed the art as it was well drawn, like I've enjoyed the soundtrack. However, while I understand the pseudo-need of putting a fairy in the game, she was speaking too much with her screams or her reflexions. After a while, you just want to make her shut up because her voice is really really striking your nerves.

True, it's a classic jigsaw game but every game in the series is bringing something different: Japan is probably the basic game, UndeadZ added more actions and Birds got a new menu and a new way to bring bonus. Anime is adding rotation and a character to guide you and to help you. However, I can understand those that can be bored by it, as it's a question also of patience. Some puzzles requires really time to be finished and once it's done, the satisfaction is great.

Yeah, I recommend this one. I suppose that the fairy will annoy many of the players but don't let the game being reduced to that. It's still a good moment to pass.

reviewText: Although my favorite game of the series was Pixel Puzzles: UndeadZ this one wins hands down as the best in the series for the simple fact that it actually saves your progress (seriously, why was this not thought of sooner). reviewText:
Great puzzle game. Includes 25 anime themed puzzled. Number of pieces are between 60 and 350. In comparison with a previous game (Pixel Puzzles: Japan) they improved a lot of things. For example the floating pieces around your table don't get stucked anymore and the puzzle is saved on exit, but pieces on the table which are not on the correct spot get resettet.

Another great improvement is the special abilities you can use (either show the original image, correct rotation or show correct spot). But the anime fairy which will grant you magic dust is very annoying after a while.
You can disable her, but then you won't get any dust and can't use those special abilities. The HUD element showing your current dust meter yet remains.

The big puzzle with 350 pieces was very hard, not because there were so many pieces and it took a while to get them all places, but the fact that you cannot zoom onto floating pieces. They were so small, my eyes hurt after a while.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=601785193
Another eye-hurting"-feature comes with the background. In some images yellow is a very common color. Too bad when the pieces with yellow color a floating on a yellow background

hoursPlayed: but after picking it up it turns out to be something from the middle\n\nFairy and dust meter are above the floating area

reviewText:
While I liked Pixel Puzzles: UndeadZ, I didn't care for the absurd minigame or playing zombie defense while I tried to solve a puzzle (to be fair, the zombie attacks are optional). PP2: Anime keeps it simple, and focuses entirely on the puzzles. That alone is enough for me to give it a strong recommendation.

Yeah there's an annoying fairy and the music isn't particularly good, but that's easily dealt with. I got several hours of play, and cut into my prog rock backlog at the same time.

..... Wait ...really? I can't think of anything else to add to this review. I spent over 10 hours on this game! Usually I'd have some overlong diatribe lined up to pad things out, but I guess that ain't the case.

Dammit!

reviewText:
I checked this out as it was one of the few jigsaw pizzle type games on steam. Unfortunently a lot of severe annoyances prevented me from enjoyed it.

First, having to continually hold the mouse button on the pieces I need to rotate it got rather tiresome on my fingers, the pieces floating around in the background made keeping track of them uncessarily difficult, and the lock in distance for the pices was huge, to the point where half the time I could just drop pieces on the board randomly in order to fit them in, negating any sense of accomplishment. I felt. The mascot fairy is annoying, though thankfulyl she can be turned off with the delete key. Also, not having cloud storage is really unforgivable for a game released in 2015.

I could only recommend this if purchased as part of a bundle, and only then to people who really are desperate for a jigsaw fix. There are many better games to spent money on
voteText: 1 person found this review helpful

reviewText:
I played this game after I finished Pixel Puzzles Japan.
This game is easier to pick up pieces than Pixel Puzzles Japan.
It is harder and longer to beat because the pieces can be rotated.
The game now saves puzzle progress so you can exit the puzzle anytime you want, unlike Pixel Puzzles Japan which remove your puzzle progress.
Still doesn't support Steam Cloud Synchronization. I can't load the game with another computer.

All pictures are anime alike, but none of them come from real anime.
The gallery shows picture in small size and completed puzzle still have pieces curves and pixel pixie is floating in the middle of the image, I can't take a screenshot of them to make a desktop wallpaper. Too bad.

Easy achievements. Basically finish all the puzzles = 100% achievements.
Trading cards. Their prices are quite high.

There is hint level bar which filled when you put the pieces correctly. Pixel pixie occasionally fills the bar. Hiding pixel pixie will stop her to fill your hint level bar.
Lv 1. Flash Ghost Image (Temporarily shows full image for about 3s)
Lv 2. Correct Rotation (Press <ctrl> while holding a piece, and it will be rotated correctly)
Lv 3. Show Location (Press <space> while holding a piece, and it will flash its location. The piece rotation is not corrected)
There are 25 puzzles + 1 DL-TV puzzle to play. From 60 pcs to 350pcs.
If you like anime, and jigsaw puzzles, you might like this game.
Note that because of rotating pieces, It took over 4 hours for me to finish the biggest puzzle with 350pcs.

reviewText: Every Pixel puzzle has been uniquely different and Anime is no different. this time you have to rotate the pieces to make them fit. Unlike Pixel Puzzle Japan, and Zombie games. Your progress is saved so you don't have to restart a puzzle you were working on when you quit the game. (Thank you Devs). The only thing I hate is the little fairy who never shuts up. Mute Please. I highly recommend Anime just turn the volume down so you won't have to hear the fairy. 10/10.

reviewText: A good challenging and fun puzzler. 25 different puzzles to put together ranging 60 pieces up to 330 for the biggest one and all in based around anime. Pieces will also click into place when you found where they are suppose to do. If you enjoy puzzles and like to relax with one sometimes then this is a game worth picking up.

reviewText:
Its a puzzle game where you find the pieces and put them into place.  I will recommend the game, but there are some annoying things to the game.

There is only 1 sound slider so you have to put up with the music along with the sound effects or nothing at all.  The biggest annoyance of all is the fact that you can't turn the puzzle pieces without having some pixel dust or what ever its called.

I found it far more effective to look for any pieces that are in the right direction and change any that were not, then drop out to the menu once out of the dust, and hop back into the puzzle to get a bunch of the needed rotation dust (this worked on the first puzzle not so far on the second puzzle), check for any pieces that might have turned to the right direction and turn 2 or 3 and then again hop out and hop back into the puzzle for the refill.  This way you could finish a puzzle in minutes instead of an hour for the small ones.

And if I put pieces on the tray, even if I leave the game, they should stay on the tray.  I had it loaded up at one point dropped out to do something came back and all the pieces were gone... thats annoying.

So out of 10 I would give this a 5.5.  If it was not for those 2 annoyances, I would give it a higher mark.

reviewText: Okay, I'll say this once: I like the Pixel Puzzles series and thoroughly enjoyed the Japan and Undeadz flavours. The Anime installment brings piece rotation to the gameplay and a very vocal helper fairy. While the gameplay is fun yon 'helper' is almost as annoying as Navi from the Zelda series, constantly urging you to use the dust-powered powerups (iow cheats) or lavishly congratulating you for placing a single piece correctly.\n\nHonestly, a nice gimmick, but poorly executed. I would urge anyone to take this into consideration before buying this game. Hopefully a future update will allow you to turn her off or at least mellow the constant barrage of remarks flung your way. Beyond that, the puzzle images are kind of nice, including a few very cute ones.

reviewText:
This game....i don't know what to say... except it's disappointing. To be honest, i planned on enjoying this game. Unfortunately some of the features ruined it for me.

What i like:
+ It's anime, anime is always good
+ Background music sounds nice
+ It has a good amount of nice looking pictures
+ And it's doable despite the weird looking tentacles on each puzzle pieces, which makes it look harder than it is.

What i hate:
- The super-duper wonderful, praiseworthy, and unquestionably annoying little fairy that just won't give me 10 seconds to relax. It was cute at first, but after a couple of minutes it's like listening to my little sister. Over and over and over...and over.... again. I can mute the game, but then what will be of use of the background music?

- What can make the situation even worse? Answer: The wait until you have enough pixie dust in order to rotate" feature is just absolutely excruciating. I can probably urge enough patience to listen to the fairy
date: but not enough to play with the fairy AND with this "wait-to-rotate" feature. That's just double the pain.\n\nOverall
recommended: the game just didn't do it for me. As the saying goes

reviewText:
[ENG / FR]

[ENG]

Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime offers 25 unlockable puzzles with the following distribution:
6x60 bits / 6x112 bits / 6x153 bits / 6x220 bits / 1x350 bits
What can we expect from the successor of Pixel Puzzles: Japan?

+ Improved bit pickup system in comparison with the previous episode
+ Improved help system in comparison with the previous episode
+ Positions of correctly placed bits are now saved at a steady frequency
+ 6 additional puzzles in comparison with the previous episode
+ Well measured progressive difficulty
+ Variety of the colors and illustrations
+ Unusual shape of the bits of some of the puzzles
+ Left bits shuffling option
+ Set color change option
+ New zoom on set" function
+ Steam cards and achievements
+ Possibility to deactivate the Pixel Pixie character

- Pixel Pixie's voice and speeches become quickly painful
- Only one track in the soundtrack which ends up to be repetitive

Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime is the proof that some developers are able to listen to their audience.
With its colorful and varied illustrations it allows you some good times in much better conditions than its predecessor.
Still adressed to the amateurs of this genre
date:
it features notable improvements that make a real difference.

The choice of the bits is now simplified and more pleasant thanks to the developers who dropped the progression system featured in the "Japan" episode.
An automatic save has been added to the game which is a very good point. A "zoom on set" function is now also available.
The help system still uses the gauge you fill while placing the right bits at the right places.
It now has 3 options: short preview of the whole picture
recommended: correct rotation of a chosen bit
hoursPlayed:
and highlighting of the correct place of a chosen bit.

Bits now appear in a random display in this episode. You have to rotate them frequently before placing them on the set.
This feature would have deserved to be a full option and not a forced feature. It's a pity.

The only real bad thing about this game lies in the soundtrack. Above the only "Rock" track looped again and again
voteText: the real pain comes from Pixel Pixie.\nThis character's voice is rather high-pitched and if its speeches are funny during the first puzzle
helpfulPercent: you may want to mute her and listen to your own music instead.\n\nTo sum it up
votesHelpful:
this game is a really good puzzle game. If you played the previous episode you will probably like this "Anime" one better.

▬

[FR]

Pixel Puzzles 2: Anime propose 25 puzzles à débloquer progressivement

reviewText:
Really liked this puzzle game, it's fun and the images are great (I like Anime)..

I don't understand why some people seem to nag about needing dust for rotating the pieces, you don't need dust for rotating the pieces, you can just use the mousebutton for that. Yeah you need dust if you want it to automatically rotate to the correct position..
Also some people seem to hate the imp, but you can just turn her off with <delete> (or use the option)..
And there is a save function, if you leave the puzzle, and come back later, it's still as you left it, any loose pieces you left on the board are floating again, that's all.
And the floating pieces makes the game more interesting, at least to me, it adds another dimension..
The only thing I didn't like was not being able to hide the dust container on the left, as I didn't want to use it and it sometimes obscures some floating pieces..

There is one thing I have to agree with, sometimes you only need to be almost a whole piece away from the correct spot and it'll click into that spot.. I would not have minded if there was an option to set the 'autolock' to a much smaller range..

But all in all, it's a great puzzle game, and I wasn't even annoyed by the little imp, I even missed her when I accidently turned her off with <delete> and there is no way to restore her (until the next puzzle) if you pressed it accidentally..

To be honest, I bought this game in a bundle with Pixel puzzle 2: birds (which I propably won't like as much due to the images) and some other games on indiegala for only 2 euro's..
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
The game is entertaining. Reachable achievements and Steam Trading Cards kept me going. Overall good game if you like jigsaw puzzles. I got this game in a bundle of ~8 games for $2 or $3. For that price, it's worth it. However, I would not pay $10 for it. I would probably pay up to $5 for it so I recommend only buying it when it's on sale. Also, I want to punch the fairy in the face.

Overall score: 9/10

Edit: I just found out from another reviewer that you can kill the fairy by pressing delete while in a puzzle. I just raised the score from an 8/10 to a 9/10 because of this. I must have missed this when I first saw the controls because the fairy was yelling at me and said something like Hurry up and read this! We need to get started!".

Edit 2: WARNING! As I just found out
recommended: you will not get any pixie green goo power crap so you may not want to do it."

reviewText:
Worse than the first one. Usually developers learn from their mistakes from their first game. Not here. They took a step back. If you play it, prepared to be annoyed. The opening menu is huge advertisement. This should warn you that the product is utter garbage. If we like your product, we will look for more. Just add another page to menu for more games from us or something like that. Controls and information is not clear. Can't change key mapping.  Pros and cons are listed below. One thing they finally did right was puzzles save now.

Pros:
It is a puzzle game
Now saves puzzles
rotate pieces

Cons:
Big Ad opening the game
Pictures are dull/boring
Annoying Fairy
Fairy's uses improper grammar
Power ups can be slow to receive
Controls are not clear
Lack of options in options menu
Still can't piece together pieces that fit together and move as a set

reviewText:
Fun little puzzle game, but that helper fairy is the most irritating thing I've ever had to deal with, far worse than Navi. The amount of times I felt like lashing out at it and telling it off, but thank goodness for the delete key that gets rid of her.

That and that looping music will drive you nuts. Please mute all game sounds and listen to your own music.

Asides from that, this is actually quite a hard puzzle game, very challenging.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: This is a casual puzzle game filled with some pleasant anime-style artwork. The interface is simple and easy to work with. You get an achievement for each puzzle you complete as well, which is nice. The smaller puzzles might take you about 1/2 hour to complete if you take your time, and the bigger puzzles... well, set aside some time if you want to complete them in one sitting. The game automatically saves your progress if you need to take a break mid-puzzle though!\n\nOverall, it's a good game. The fairy is annoying... but the DELETE key makes that horridly annoying fairy go away so you don't have to listen to her as you play, as she is INCREDIBLY ANNOYING. It makes the game considerably more enjoyable once she's gone. Turn off the sound, pop on your music of choice, and enjoy a nice relaxing anime puzzle.

reviewText:
Really liked this puzzle game, it's fun and the images are great (I like Anime)..

I don't understand why some people seem to nag about needing dust for rotating the pieces, you don't need dust for rotating the pieces, you can just use the mousebutton for that. Yeah you need dust if you want it to automatically rotate to the correct position..
Also some people seem to hate the imp, but you can just turn her off with <delete> (or use the option)..
And there is a save function, if you leave the puzzle, and come back later, it's still as you left it, any loose pieces you left on the board are floating again, that's all.
And the floating pieces makes the game more interesting, at least to me, it adds another dimension..
The only thing I didn't like was not being able to hide the dust container on the left, as I didn't want to use it and it sometimes obscures some floating pieces..

There is one thing I have to agree with, sometimes you only need to be almost a whole piece away from the correct spot and it'll click into that spot.. I would not have minded if there was an option to set the 'autolock' to a much smaller range..

But all in all, it's a great puzzle game, and I wasn't even annoyed by the little imp, I even missed her when I accidently turned her off with <delete> and there is no way to restore her (until the next puzzle) if you pressed it accidentally..

To be honest, I bought this game in a bundle with Pixel puzzle 2: birds (which I propably won't like as much due to the images) and some other games on indiegala for only 2 euro's..

reviewText:
The game is entertaining. Reachable achievements and Steam Trading Cards kept me going. Overall good game if you like jigsaw puzzles. I got this game in a bundle of ~8 games for $2 or $3. For that price, it's worth it. However, I would not pay $10 for it. I would probably pay up to $5 for it so I recommend only buying it when it's on sale. Also, I want to punch the fairy in the face.

Overall score: 9/10

Edit: I just found out from another reviewer that you can kill the fairy by pressing delete while in a puzzle. I just raised the score from an 8/10 to a 9/10 because of this. recommended: you will not get any pixie green goo power crap so you may not want to do it."

reviewText:
Game is really good, puzzle are entertaining and the art is great. Except for one thing and everyone say it so of course I going to say it. THE FAIRY....she annoying but that is bad is that you can push delete to get rid of her however it take away your special and you can't use them for the whole puzzle.

Pretty much it annoying nagging voice with use of special to help you on the puzzle or peaceful slient with no specials........reminds me of movie saw with the jigsaw killer......do you want to ears to bleed from listening to an annoying voice or get a headache from no help with the puzzle as you stare blankly at the screen think what to do

Music is pretty basic could be better but easy fix is just turn the music down in the game and open up your music player on your computer and now your able to relax as you puzzle out

reviewText:
This is my 2nd Pixel Puzzles game, my first is the Japan-themed one. I have to say, I got exactly what I expected for a sequel to that game. I recommend it to anyone who likes jigsaw puzzles or has enjoyed a previous Pixel Puzzles game.

Best Features:-	Really nice artwork featuring a good variety of anime art styles
-	Helpful user interface for those who have trouble with puzzle games
-	Enough puzzles to justify its price
•	(Although, it's always better to just buy it on sale)
-	Easy achievements

Worst Features:-	Subpar soundtrack
•	(Just mute the game and listen to your own music)
-	 The fairy who:
•	Blocks your user interface
•	Is needed to make the puzzle easier
•	Has a really bad art style
•	Will not be quiet for 10 seconds
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
FYI this is NOT fanservice anime.

The Pixel Puzzles 2 series (Anime, Birds, Space) certainly has improvements over their first 2 tries (Japan and Zombies). 25 puzzles (26 if you count the like 20 piece minigame)

Pros:
-Good afk time killer that you don't need to pay attention to
-The pieces no longer are rotated to the correct position making this series a decent amount more difficult.
-Decent powers that aren't 100% tied to dice roll of putting down the right piece to fill a bar. Now there are 3 powers 1- Correct rotation for piece 2- Ghost image 3- Show placement on board for current piece.
-The puzzle moat" where the pieces are is much improved in this series
-It's a puzzle game you really should know what to expect

Cons:
-Unplayable with sound. There is a "helpful" fairy that won't shut up and there is no options to disable so just turn off audio and put on whatever you like listening to since the sounds don't add much anyway.
-Each puzzle only has X number of pieces you can't play any with different piece counts
date:
same as the first series.

IMO it's worth it on a sale. I play this afk at work so this is great as it never requires 100% of my attention.

Edit: They apperently did update where you can press "Delete" and it will remove the fairy but the game does not tell you that
recommended: had to read it on a forum.\n\nHad ~25 hours when I finished all of the puzzles but that is time the game was open and not actual gameplay."
voteText: true
